register.description: VPIF Identification

bitfield.description: Used to distinguish between old scheme and current. Spare bit to encode future schemes. Fixed to be "01"
Function indicates an S/W compatible module family. If there is not level of S/W compatibility, a new Func number (and hence PID) should be assigned
Indicates RTL version

Local revision number which should be owned by module designer. This number should be updated for each major design change (such as bug fix, and memory size change etcÂ…). In present design, fixed to be 0
Indicates a special version for a particular device. Consequence of use may avoid use of standard chip support library (CSL). In this module, fixed to be 0.
Local revision number which should be owned by module designer. This number should be updated for each small design change. In present design, fixed to be 0.

register.description: Channel#0 control register

bitfield.description: This register defines timing relationship between data phase and clock edge for video input data which is connected to VPIF channel 0 (at the chip-pin level). Edge control is carried out outside the module (just register signal is only asserted from the module) 0: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock 1: data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitenum.description: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock
data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitfield.description: Data bit width 00: 8 bit/pixel 01: 10 bit/pixel 10: 12 bit/pixel
Line interrrupt interval
Field ID polarity

bitenum.description: Invert incoming field ID signal inside the module

bitfield.description: Vertical pixel valid signal polarity control

bitenum.description: Invert incoming "vertical pixel valid" signal inside the module

bitfield.description: Horizontal pixel valid signal polarity control

bitenum.description: Invert incoming "horizontal pixel valid" signal inside the module

bitfield.description: SDRAM storage mode of input picture
Output display format
Channel#0 Vertical Ancillary data enable 0:Vertical ancillary Data not supported 1:Vertical ancillary data is supported
Channel#0 Horizontal Ancillary data enable 0: Horizontal ancillary Data not supported 1:Horizontal ancillary data is supported
Channel#0 Frame level interrupt to CPU 00: top field V-sync only 01: bottom field V-sync only 10: both top and bottom field V-sync 11: Reserved
Channel#0 Field Identification
SDRAM address format control register 0: raster scanning mode 1: sub-picture mode
Channel#0 input data format 0: Y/C non-multiplexed mode 1: Y/C multiplexed mode
Channel#0 data mode to be processed 0x: BT. video (Y/C format) capture mode (sync signal is multiplexed). 1x: CCD/CMOS data capture mode (sync signal is independently prepared).
Channel#0 VPIF enable 0: Channel#0 VPIF module inactivated 1: Channel#0 VPIF module activated

register.description: Channel#1 control register

bitfield.description: This register defines timing relationship between data phase and clock edge for video input data which is connected to VPIF channel 1 (at the chip-pin level). Edge control is carried out outside the module (just register signal is only asserted from the module) 0: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock 1: data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitenum.description: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock
data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitfield.description: Output display format 0: Interlaced (60 [field/sec]) format. 1: Progressive (30 [frame/sec]) format.
Channel#1 Vertical Ancillary data enable 0: Vertical Ancillary Data not supported 1: Vertical ancillary data is supported
Channel#1 Horizontal Ancillary data enable 0: Horizontal ancillary Data not supported 1:Horizontal ancillary data is supported
Channel#1 Frame level interrupt to CPU 00: top field V-sync only 01: bottom field V-sync only 10: both top and bottom field V-sync 11: Reserved
Channel#1 Field Identification
SDRAM address format control register 0: raster scanning mode 1: sub-picture mode
Channel#1 input data format 0: Y/C non-multiplexed mode 1: Y/C multiplexed mode
Channel#1 data mode to be processed 0x: BT. video (Y/C format) capture mode (sync signal is multiplexed). 1x: CCD/CMOS data capture mode (sync signal is independently prepared).
Channel#1 VPIF enable 0: Channel#1 VPIF module inactivated 1: Channel#1 VPIF module activated

register.description: Channel#2 control register

bitfield.description: This register defines timing relationship between data phase and clock edge for video output data which is connected to VPIF channel 2 (at the chip-pin level). Edge control is carried out outside the module (just register signal is only asserted from the module) 0: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock 1: data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitenum.description: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock
data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitfield.description: SDRAM storage mode of output picture 0: field independently stored. 1: frame based.
Output display format 0: Interlaced (60 [field/sec]) format. 1: Progressive (30 [frame/sec]) format.
Pixel data enable or disable 0: Pixel data disabled 1: Pixel data enabled
Channel#2 Vertical Ancillary data enable 0: Vertical Ancillary Data not supported 1: Vertical ancillary data is supported
Channel#2 Horizontal Ancillary data enable 0: Horizontal ancillary Data not supported 1:Horizontal ancillary data is supported
Channel#2 Frame level interrupt to CPU 00: top field V-sync only 01: bottom field V-sync only 10: both top and bottom field V-sync 11: Reserved
Channel#2 Field Identification
SDRAM address format control register 0: raster scanning mode 1: sub-picture mode
Channel#2 data format to be transmitted 0: Y/C non-multiplexed mode 1: Y/C multiplexed mode
Channel#2 VPIF Clock enable 0: Channel#2 clock inactivated 1: Channel#2 clock activated
Channel#2 VPIF enable 0: Channel#2 VPIF module inactivated 1: Channel#2 VPIF module activated

register.description: Channel#3 control register

bitfield.description: This register defines timing relationship between data phase and clock edge for video output data which is connected to VPIF channel 3 (at the chip-pin level). Edge control is carried out outside the module (just register signal is only asserted from the module) 0: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock 1: data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitenum.description: data phase is changed at rising edge of the input clock
data phase is changed at falling edge of the input clock

bitfield.description: Output display format 0: Interlaced (60 [field/sec]) format. 1: Progressive (30 [frame/sec]) format.
Pixel data enable or disable 0: Pixel data disabled 1: Pixel data enabled
Channel#3 Vertical Ancillary data enable 0: Vertical Ancillary Data not supported 1: Vertical ancillary data is supported
Channel#3 Horizontal Ancillary data enable 0: Horizontal ancillary Data not supported 1:Horizontal ancillary data is supported
Channel#3 Frame level interrupt to CPU 00: top field V-sync only 01: bottom field V-sync only 10: both top and bottom field V-sync 11: Reserved
Channel#3 Field Identification
SDRAM address format control register 0: raster scanning mode 1: sub-picture mode
Channel#3 data format to be transmitted 0: Y/C non-multiplexed mode 1: Y/C multiplexed mode
Channel#3 VPIF Clock enable 0: Channel#3 clock inactivated 1: Channel#3 clock activated
Channel#3 VPIF enable 0: Channel#3 VPIF module inactivated 1: Channel#3 VPIF module activated

register.description: Used for TI internal testing

bitfield.description: Synchronization mode on VPIF channel 1 0: free mode (searching header code consists of "FF-00-00-SAV (EAV)" 1: hold mode (driven by internal counter)
Synchronization mode on VPIF channel 0 0: free mode (searching header code consists of "FF-00-00-SAV (EAV)" 1: hold mode (driven by internal counter)
VPIF channel#1 synchronize status 0: Channel-1 not synchronized 1: Channel-1 synchronized
VPIF channel#0 synchronize status 0: Channel-0 not synchronized 1: Channel-0 synchronized
VPIF channel 3 status register indicating existence of buffer overflow or underflow 0: buffer overflow/underflow error doesn't exist. 1: buffer overflow/underflow error exists.
VPIF channel 2 status register indicating existence of buffer overflow or underflow 0: buffer overflow/underflow error doesn't exist. 1: buffer overflow/underflow error exists.
VPIF channel 1 status register indicating existence of buffer overflow or underflow 0: buffer overflow/underflow error doesn't exist. 1: buffer overflow/underflow error exists.
VPIF channel 0 status register indicating existence of buffer overflow or underflow 0: buffer overflow/underflow error doesn't exist. 1: buffer overflow/underflow error exists.
Channel 1 status register indicating existence of error sync distance between SAV and EAV 0: Sync distance error doesn't exist 1: Sync distance error exists
Channel 0 status register indicating existence of error sync distance between SAV and EAV 0: Sync distance error doesn't exist 1: Sync distance error exists
status register indicating existence of error bit on SAV and EAV signal for VPIF channel 1 0: SAV/EAV bit error doesn't exists 1: SAV/EAV bit error exists
status register indicating existence of error bit on SAV and EAV signal for VPIF channel 0 0: SAV/EAV bit error doesn't exists 1: SAV/EAV bit error exists

register.description: Interrupt enable register

bitfield.description: To activate error interrupt 0: Error interrupt disabled 1: Error interrupt enabled
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#3 0: Channel#3 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#3 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#2 0: Channel#2 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#2 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#1 0: Channel#1 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#1 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#0 0: Channel#0 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#0 Frame interrupt enable

register.description: Interrupt activation register

bitfield.description: To activate error interrupt 0: Error interrupt disabled 1: Error interrupt enabled
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#3 0: Channel#3 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#3 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#2 0: Channel#2 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#2 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#1 0: Channel#1 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#1 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#0 0: Channel#0 Frame interrupt disable 1: Channel#0 Frame interrupt enable

register.description: Interrupt clear register

bitfield.description: To activate error interrupt 0: No change 1: Interrupt on vpif_inten_error inactivated
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#3 0: NC 1: Interrupt on vpif_inten_frame_ch3 inactivated
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#2 0: NC 1: Channel#2 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#1 0: NC 1: Channel#1 Frame interrupt enable
Frame interrupt enable for Channel#0 0: NC 1: Channel#0 Frame interrupt enable

register.description: Interrupt Status register

bitfield.description: Error interrupt status 0: Error is not detected so far 1: Error is detected and not checked yet
Frame sync detect for Channel#3 0: Channel#3 Frame sync not detected 1: Channel#3 Frame sync detected
Frame sync detect for Channel#2 0: Channel#2 Frame sync not detected 1: Channel#2 Frame sync detected
Frame sync detect for Channel#1 0: Channel#1 Frame sync not detected 1: Channel#1 Frame sync detected
Frame sync detect for Channel#0 0: Channel#0 Frame sync not detected 1: Channel#0 Frame sync detected

register.description: Interrupt Status clear register

bitfield.description: Status clear register 0: No Change 1: VPIF status clear resiger
Channel#3 status clear register 0: No change 1: Channel#3 status clear register
Channel#2 status clear register 0: No change 1: Channel#2 status clear register
Channel#1 status clear register 0: No change 1: Channel#1 status clear register
Channel#0 status clear register 0: No change 1: Channel#0 status clear register

register.description: Emulation suspend control register

bitfield.description: Peripheral respond to emulation suspend signal control 0: Emulation control based on vpif_emulsusp_soft 1: Emulation configuration ignore

register.description: VPIF DMA request unit size control register

bitfield.description: DMA request unit size 000100000: 32 byte 001000000: 64 byte 010000000: 128 byte 100000000: 256 byte

register.description: IODFT control register

bitfield.description: IODFT control bits 000: Normal function mode 001: Reserved 010: Reserved 011: Reserved 100: Loop Back with PAD 101: Internal loop back 110: Input buffer test 111: Reserved
